en-US.alert_about: Create, manage, and view the shortcuts that will automatically run via Autocuts as you use your iOS device.
en-US.alert_donate: Thank you for donating and supporting my Shortcuts development!
en-US.alert_help_advanced:
Visit Autocuts Admin's Settings page for additional options for controlling Autocuts.

â€¢Â Verify Shortcuts: When checked, Autocuts Admin will generate a list of shortcuts that Autocuts will match against when running. If a shortcut does not exist, it will not run.

â€¢ Log Activity: Autocuts will write a log file of its activity in iCloud Drive > Shortcuts > Autocuts > log-{devicename}.txt.

â€¢Â Notify After Evaluation: When run, Autocuts will display the current log file after evaluating your Autocuts but before running the shortcuts.
en-US.alert_help_limitkit:
By default, the Open App personal automation will cause Autocuts to run every time you open one of your apps.

LimitKit allows you to control the frequency at which Autocuts will evaluate your Autocuts in your Dropbox sources.

For example, you can configure Autocuts to run every minute, five minutes, thirty minutes, or hour. 

When its time limit has not elapsed, Autocuts will exit much more quickly when run from the Open App personal automation, preserving battery life.
en-US.alert_help_setup1:
To run your shortcuts automatically, Autocuts must be configured to run each time you open your most commonly used apps.

1. Tap Automation in Shortcuts.

2. Tap the + button.

3. Tap Create Personal Automation

4. Choose Open App

5. Select the apps you use often and tap Done.
en-US.alert_help_setup2:
6. Tap Next.

7. Tap Add Action.

9. Add a Run Shortcut action and set it to Autocuts.

10. Tap Show More and disable Show While Running.

11. Tap Next and disable Ask Before Running.

12. Tap Done.
en-US.alert_help_setup3:
Now, whenever you open one of your selected apps, Autocuts will run in the backup.

Autocuts created by Autocuts Admin or a Destination Service will be processed and their shortcuts run.

You can limit how often Autocuts by installing LimitKit and configuring Autocut's LimitKit settings in Settings.
en-US.alert_help_creating:
Autocuts can be created in a number of ways. Any application that can write to a Dropbox folder can create an Autocut.

Some examples include:

â€¢ Autocuts Admin: the shortcut you are using now features an assistant that walks tou step-by-step in creating an Autocut. 

â€¢ API: Send the Autocuts Admin a specially-formatted dictionary to create and schedule Autocuts from a third-party shortcut. 

â€¢ IFTTT or Zapier: any trigger can write an Autocut text file to an Autocuts Dropbox source folder.
en-US.alert_help_destinations:
Destination services deliver Autocuts to local and remote sources. Autocuts Admin supports the following destination services:

â€¢ Dropbox: specify a Dropbox folder path where to store your Autocut files. Make sure to add this folder path as a source if you want Autocuts on this device to process them.

â€¢ IFTTT: enter a Maker Webhooks Event name and API key to send a webhook to IFTTT which will create an Autocut file on Dropbox.

â€¢ Zapier: provide a catch hook URL to send an Autocut to Zapier. The Zap will then create the Autocut in a Dropbox folder. 

For the IFTTT and Zapier, read the full documentation on how to configure and use these services.
en-US.alert_help_sources:
Autocut Sources are folders on Dropbox that hold your Autocut files. 

When you add a source to Autocuts using Autocuts Admin, any file whose filename begins with "Autocut" or "autocut" will be processed whenever Autocuts runs. 

If an Autocut file is valid for the current time and has not expired, the shortcut specified in the Autocut will run. 

ADVANCED
Setting up shared Dropbox folders as Autocut sources will allow shortcuts to run automatically on remote iOS devices as their owners use them throughout the day.

en-US.name: English
en-US.prompt_autocut_service:
Select the destination for this Autocut.

Choosing a remote destination allows you to run shortcuts automatically on other devices that use Autocuts.
en-US.prompt_delete: Delete this Autocut? This operation cannot be undone.
en-US.prompt_delete_multiple: Delete the selected Autocuts? This operation cannot be undone.
en-US.prompt_donate: Enjoying Autocuts? Send me a tip to help fund future development of Autocuts and other shortcuts.
en-US.prompt_dropboxPath: Path in Dropbox where Autocut entries are located.
en-US.prompt_erase_content:
Are you sure you want to delete all Autocuts content and settings for this device?

This operation cannot be undone.
en-US.prompt_erase_content2:
Are you ABSOLUTELY SURE you want to delete all Autocuts  content and settings for this device?

This operation cannot be undone.
en-US.prompt_input: Choose data that you would like to send to the shortcut when run.
en-US.prompt_input_askShortcut: Autocuts will call {{shortcut}} with "Autocuts Custom Input". Confirm that the shortcut will display custom UI for providing input for this Autocut.
en-US.prompt_input_date: Enter a date that will be sent to the shortcut when it runs.
en-US.prompt_input_datetime: Enter a date and time that will be sent to the shortcut when it runs
en-US.prompt_input_location: Enter an address that will be sent to the shortcut when it runs
en-US.prompt_input_number: Enter a number that will be sent to the shortcut when it runs
en-US.prompt_input_text: Enter text that will be sent to the shortcut. Use tokens {{location}}, {{location_weather}}, {{datetime}}, {{date}}, and {{time}} to insert the current location, weather location, etc. into the Autocut
en-US.prompt_input_time: Enter a time that will be sent to the shortcut when it runs.
en-US.prompt_limitkit_interval: Enter the number of seconds to wait before Autocuts can run again:
en-US.prompt_list:
Displaying files in all of your source folders that begin with 'autocut' or 'Autocut'.

Tap an Autocut for more information:
en-US.prompt_option_continueInShortcuts:
Run the shortcut in the background or open the Shortcuts app before running?

NOTE: Some shortcuts require the Shortcuts app to be the active application in order to run properly.
en-US.prompt_option_device: Run this Autocut on this device, all devices, or a specific device?
en-US.prompt_option_deviceName:
Enter the name of the iOS device on which this Autocut will run.

You can find the device name in Settings > General > About > Name
en-US.prompt_option_expiration:
Set the default expiration time for new Autocuts.

-1 - repeating and non-expiring

0 - run and expire

> 0 - Autocut will expire and not run its shortcut after specified number of minutes.
en-US.prompt_option_schedule: When do you want this Autocut to become available for running?
en-US.prompt_option_scheduleCustom: Choose a custom date for your Autocut?
en-US.prompt_reset: Reset Autocuts settings or erase all content and settings for Autocuts?
en-US.prompt_reset_settings:
Are you sure you want to reset Autocuts settings on this device?

None of your content will be affected.
en-US.prompt_service_delete: Delete this service? This operation cannot be undone.
en-US.prompt_service_dropbox: Enter the path to the folder on Dropbox where Autocuts will be saved using this destination service:
en-US.prompt_service_dropbox_details: Using this destination service will place Autocuts in the following folder on Dropbox:
en-US.prompt_service_ifttt_apikey: Enter the IFTTT Webhook API Key:
en-US.prompt_service_ifttt_details: Autocuts will be sent to the following IFTTT webhook:
en-US.prompt_service_ifttt_event: Enter the event name for the IFTTT Webhook:
en-US.prompt_service_name: Enter a name for this service
en-US.prompt_service_new:
Select the type of Autocut Destination Service to create.

â€¢ Dropbox: Creates Autocuts in Dropbox folders local to this iOS device.

â€¢ IFTTT and Zapier: Calls the webhook triggers of these two services to write to remote Dropbox folders.
en-US.prompt_service_zapier: Enter the Zapier Custom Webhook URL:
en-US.prompt_service_zapier_details: Autocuts will be sent to the following Zapier webhook:
en-US.prompt_services: Autocut Destinations allow you to create Autocuts locally or on remote iOS devices.
en-US.prompt_sources:
Sources are folders on Dropbox where your Autocuts are located.

Autocuts can be placed in sources locally using Autocuts Admin or remotely with services like IFTTT and Zapier.
en-US.prompt_source_delete: Delete this source? None of the files stored on Dropbox will be affected. This operation cannot be undone.
en-US.prompt_source_dropboxPath: Enter the path to the Autocuts source folder on Dropbox
en-US.prompt_source_name: Enter a descriptive name for this source
en-US.prompt_source_shortcuts: Should Autocuts in this source be allowed to run any shortcut on this device or select ones?
en-US.prompt_source_shortcutsChoose: Select the shortcuts that Autocuts in this source can run:
en-US.prompt_source_shortcutsRemove: Select shortcuts to remove from the list of allowed shortcuts.
